text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus according to the commandment of God our Savior, and of Christ Jesus, who is our hope,
speaker: Narrator

text: To Timothy, my true son in the faith: Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as I urged you upon my departure for Macedonia, to remain on at Ephesus so that you would instruct certain people not to teach strange doctrines,
speaker: Narrator

text: nor to pay attention to myths and endless genealogies, which give rise to useless speculation rather than advance the plan of God, which is by faith, so I urge you now.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the goal of our instruction is love from a pure heart, from a good conscience, and from a sincere faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some people have strayed from these things and have turned aside to fruitless discussion,
speaker: Narrator

text: wanting to be teachers of the Law, even though they do not understand either what they are saying or the matters about which they make confident assertions.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we know that the Law is good, if one uses it lawfully,
speaker: Narrator

text: realizing the fact that law is not made for a righteous person but for those who are lawless and rebellious, for the ungodly and sinners, for the unholy and worldly, for those who kill their fathers or mothers, for murderers,
speaker: Narrator

text: for the sexually immoral, homosexuals, slave traders, liars, perjurers, and whatever else is contrary to sound teaching,
speaker: Narrator

text: according to the glorious gospel of the blessed God, with which I have been entrusted.
speaker: Narrator

text: I thank Christ Jesus our Lord, who has strengthened me, because He considered me faithful, putting me into service,
speaker: Narrator

text: even though I was previously a blasphemer and a persecutor and a violent aggressor. Yet I was shown mercy because I acted ignorantly in unbelief;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the grace of our Lord was more than abundant, with the faith and love which are found in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is a trustworthy statement, deserving full acceptance, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners, among whom I am foremost.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet for this reason I found mercy, so that in me as the foremost sinner Jesus Christ might demonstrate His perfect patience as an example for those who would believe in Him for eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now to the King eternal, immortal, invisible, the only God, be honor and glory forever and ever. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: This command I entrust to you, Timothy, my son, in accordance with the prophecies previously made concerning you, that by them you fight the good fight,
speaker: Narrator

text: keeping faith and a good conscience, which some have rejected and suffered shipwreck in regard to their faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Among these are Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I have handed over to Satan, so that they will be taught not to blaspheme.
speaker: Narrator

text: First of all, then, I urge that requests, prayers, intercession, and thanksgiving be made in behalf of all people,
speaker: Narrator

text: for kings and all who are in authority, so that we may lead a tranquil and quiet life in all godliness and dignity.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is good and acceptable in the sight of God our Savior,
speaker: Narrator

text: who wants all people to be saved and to come to the knowledge of the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there is one God, and one mediator also between God and mankind, the Man Christ Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: who gave Himself as a ransom for all, the testimony given at the proper time.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this I was appointed as a preacher and an apostle (I am telling the truth, I am not lying), as a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I want the men in every place to pray, lifting up holy hands, without anger and dispute.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise, I want women to adorn themselves with proper clothing, modestly and discreetly, not with braided hair and gold or pearls or expensive apparel,
speaker: Narrator

text: but rather by means of good works, as is proper for women making a claim to godliness.
speaker: Narrator

text: A woman must quietly receive instruction with entire submissiveness.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I do not allow a woman to teach or to exercise authority over a man, but to remain quiet.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it was Adam who was first created, and then Eve.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was not Adam who was deceived, but the woman was deceived and became a wrongdoer.
speaker: Narrator

text: But women will be preserved through childbirth—if they continue in faith, love, and sanctity, with moderation.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is a trustworthy statement: if any man aspires to the office of overseer, it is a fine work he desires to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: An overseer, then, must be above reproach, the husband of one wife, temperate, self-controlled, respectable, hospitable, skillful in teaching,
speaker: Narrator

text: not overindulging in wine, not a bully, but gentle, not contentious, free from the love of money.
speaker: Narrator

text: He must be one who manages his own household well, keeping his children under control with all dignity
speaker: Narrator

text: (but if a man does not know how to manage his own household, how will he take care of the church of God?),
speaker: Narrator

text: and not a new convert, so that he will not become conceited and fall into condemnation incurred by the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he must have a good reputation with those outside the church, so that he will not fall into disgrace and the snare of the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deacons likewise must be men of dignity, not insincere, not prone to drink much wine, not greedy for money,
speaker: Narrator

text: but holding to the mystery of the faith with a clear conscience.
speaker: Narrator

text: These men must also first be tested; then have them serve as deacons if they are beyond reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text: Women must likewise be dignified, not malicious gossips, but temperate, faithful in all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deacons must be husbands of one wife, and good managers of their children and their own households.
speaker: Narrator

text: For those who have served well as deacons obtain for themselves a high standing and great confidence in the faith that is in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am writing these things to you, hoping to come to you before long;
speaker: Narrator

text: but in case I am delayed, I write so that you will know how one should act in the household of God, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and support of the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Beyond question, great is the mystery of godliness:
He who was revealed in the flesh,
Was vindicated in the Spirit,
Seen by angels,
Proclaimed among the nations,
Believed on in the world,
Taken up in glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Spirit explicitly says that in later times some will fall away from the faith, paying attention to deceitful spirits and teachings of demons,
speaker: Narrator

text: by means of the hypocrisy of liars seared in their own conscience as with a branding iron,
speaker: Narrator

text: who forbid marriage and advocate abstaining from foods which God has created to be gratefully shared in by those who believe and know the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For everything created by God is good, and nothing is to be rejected if it is received with gratitude;
speaker: Narrator

text: for it is sanctified by means of the word of God and prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: In pointing out these things to the brothers and sisters, you will be a good servant of Christ Jesus, constantly nourished on the words of the faith and of the good doctrine which you have been following.
speaker: Narrator

text: But stay away from worthless stories that are typical of old women. Rather, discipline yourself for the purpose of godliness;
speaker: Narrator

text: for bodily training is just slightly beneficial, but godliness is beneficial for all things, since it holds promise for the present life and also for the life to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is a trustworthy statement deserving full acceptance.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is for this we labor and strive, because we have set our hope on the living God, who is the Savior of all mankind, especially of believers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Prescribe and teach these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let no one look down on your youthfulness, but rather in speech, conduct, love, faith, and purity, show yourself an example of those who believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Until I come, give your attention to the public reading, to exhortation, and teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not neglect the spiritual gift within you, which was granted to you through words of prophecy with the laying on of hands by the council of elders.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take pains with these things; be absorbed in them, so that your progress will be evident to all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pay close attention to yourself and to the teaching; persevere in these things, for as you do this you will save both yourself and those who hear you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not sharply rebuke an older man, but rather appeal to him as a father, and to the younger men as brothers,
speaker: Narrator

text: to the older women as mothers, and to the younger women as sisters, in all purity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor widows who are actually widows;
speaker: Narrator

text: but if any widow has children or grandchildren, they must first learn to show proper respect for their own family and to give back compensation to their parents; for this is acceptable in the sight of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now she who is actually a widow and has been left alone has set her hope on God, and she continues in requests and prayers night and day.
speaker: Narrator

text: But she who indulges herself in luxury is dead, even while she lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give these instructions as well, so that they may be above reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if anyone does not provide for his own, and especially for those of his household, he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.
speaker: Narrator

text: A widow is to be put on the list only if she is not less than sixty years old, having been the wife of one man,
speaker: Narrator

text: having a reputation for good works; and if she has brought up children, if she has shown hospitality to strangers, if she has washed the saints’ feet, if she has assisted those in distress, and if she has devoted herself to every good work.
speaker: Narrator

text: But refuse to register younger widows, for when they feel physical desires alienating them from Christ, they want to get married,
speaker: Narrator

text: thereby incurring condemnation, because they have ignored their previous pledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the same time they also learn to be idle, as they go around from house to house; and not merely idle, but also they become gossips and busybodies, talking about things not proper to mention.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, I want younger widows to get married, have children, manage their households, and give the enemy no opportunity for reproach;
speaker: Narrator

text: for some have already turned away to follow Satan.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any woman who is a believer has dependent widows, she must assist them and the church must not be burdened, so that it may assist those who are actually widows.
speaker: Narrator

text: The elders who lead well are to be considered worthy of double honor, especially those who work hard at preaching and teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Scripture says, “You shall not muzzle the ox while it is threshing,” and “The laborer is worthy of his wages.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not accept an accusation against an elder except on the basis of two or three witnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who continue in sin, rebuke in the presence of all, so that the rest also will be fearful of sinning.
speaker: Narrator

text: I solemnly exhort you in the presence of God and of Christ Jesus and of His chosen angels, to maintain these principles without bias, doing nothing in a spirit of partiality.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not lay hands upon anyone too quickly and thereby share responsibility for the sins of others; keep yourself free from sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not go on drinking only water, but use a little wine for the sake of your stomach and your frequent ailments.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sins of some people are quite evident, going before them to judgment; for others, their sins follow after.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise also, deeds that are good are quite evident, and those which are otherwise cannot be concealed.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who are under the yoke as slaves are to regard their own masters as worthy of all honor so that the name of God and our doctrine will not be spoken against.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who have believers as their masters must not be disrespectful to them because they are brothers or sisters, but must serve them all the more, because those who partake of the benefit are believers and beloved. Teach and preach these principles.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone advocates a different doctrine and does not agree with sound words, those of our Lord Jesus Christ, and with the doctrine conforming to godliness,
speaker: Narrator

text: he is conceited and understands nothing; but he has a sick craving for controversial questions and disputes about words, from which come envy, strife, abusive language, evil suspicions,
speaker: Narrator

text: and constant friction between people of depraved mind and deprived of the truth, who suppose that godliness is a means of gain.
speaker: Narrator

text: But godliness actually is a means of great gain when accompanied by contentment.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we have brought nothing into the world, so we cannot take anything out of it, either.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we have food and covering, with these we shall be content.
speaker: Narrator

text: But those who want to get rich fall into temptation and a trap, and many foolish and harmful desires which plunge people into ruin and destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the love of money is a root of all sorts of evil, and some by longing for it have wandered away from the faith and pierced themselves with many griefs.
speaker: Narrator

text: But flee from these things, you man of God, and pursue righteousness, godliness, faith, love, perseverance, and gentleness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fight the good fight of faith; take hold of the eternal life to which you were called, and for which you made the good confession in the presence of many witnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: I direct you in the presence of God, who gives life to all things, and of Christ Jesus, who testified the good confession before Pontius Pilate,
speaker: Narrator

text: that you keep the commandment without fault or reproach until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: which He will bring about at the proper time—He who is the blessed and only Sovereign, the King of kings and Lord of lords,
speaker: Narrator

text: who alone possesses immortality and dwells in unapproachable light, whom no one has seen or can see. To Him be honor and eternal dominion! Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instruct those who are rich in this present world not to be conceited or to set their hope on the uncertainty of riches, but on God, who richly supplies us with all things to enjoy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instruct them to do good, to be rich in good works, to be generous and ready to share,
speaker: Narrator

text: storing up for themselves the treasure of a good foundation for the future, so that they may take hold of that which is truly life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Timothy, protect what has been entrusted to you, avoiding worldly, empty chatter and the opposing arguments of what is falsely called “knowledge”—
speaker: Narrator

text:
which some have professed and thereby have gone astray from the faith.
Grace be with you.
speaker: Narrator
